SINP Research Internship 2026: Eligibility, Stipend, How to Apply, Dates

Saha Institute of Nuclear Physics 2026 research internship guide with domains and application steps.

CompanySaha Institute of Nuclear Physics (SINP)
RoleResearch Intern
LocationSINP, Kolkata
Duration6–8 weeks
StipendExpected/Indicative: stipend available; hostel limited
Work HoursFull-time on-site
Employment TypeIntern
ExperiencePhysics/math foundations; coding or lab skills

Eligibility & Skills

  • Senior UG/PG in physics/maths/CS with relevant coursework
  • Education: B.Sc./M.Sc./B.Tech/M.Tech
  • Branches allowed: Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering
  • Skills: Quantum/classical foundations, Programming or lab measurements, Data analysis
  • Year of study: Pre-final/final UG or early PG
  • Age limit: Per institute norms

SINP Research Internship 2026: Eligibility, Stipend, How to Apply, Dates

Introduction

SINP offers summer projects across nuclear, high-energy, condensed matter physics, and computation. This guide summarizes 2026 eligibility, stipend, and application steps (Expected/Indicative dates).

Program Overview

On-site 6–8 week research with faculty supervision, ending in a presentation/report. Stipend usually provided; hostel space limited.

Domains Offered

  • Nuclear and high-energy physics
  • Condensed matter and materials
  • Astrophysics and cosmology
  • Computational/theoretical physics

Eligibility

  • Strong physics/math background; coding or lab skills
  • SOP aligned to a faculty group; high CGPA helpful

How to Apply

  1. Check SINP internship call. 2) Identify groups and craft SOP. 3) Submit CV, transcript, and references if asked. 4) Respond quickly to tasks/queries.

FAQs

  • Paid? Expected/Indicative: stipend available; confirm in offer.
  • Remote? On-site only.
  • Can it extend? Possible via project student roles if invited.

Ready to apply?

Applications close on 28 February 2026.
